platformVariations.behaviorNotes: System-wide color panel shared across apps. Supports eyedropper. Integrates with color spaces.

platformVariations.name: ColorPicker (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Square spectrum picker with hue ring or slider. Includes hex, RGB, HSV inputs.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports color spectrum, color preview, and text input. Optional alpha channel.

platformVariations.name: input[type=color] / custom picker
platformVariations.visualNotes: Native color input shows a browser-specific picker. Custom pickers provide richer UIs.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Native input returns hex value. Custom pickers use canvas for spectrum. EyeDropper API available in Chromium.

name: Toolbar
description: A bar containing action buttons and controls relevant to the current content or context, distinct from navigation bars.

parts.label: Action Buttons
parts.description: Icon or text buttons for performing actions on the current content.

parts.label: Spacer / Flexible Space
parts.description: Flexible gaps that distribute buttons evenly or group them.

parts.label: Separator
parts.description: Divider between logical groups of toolbar items.

parts.label: Overflow Menu
parts.description: Menu (···) for additional actions that don't fit in the toolbar.

parts.label: Bar Background
parts.description: The toolbar's background surface, which may be translucent.

placement.position: Bottom of the screen (iOS), top of window (macOS, Windows), or contextual
placement.context: Used in content editors, email, messaging, and any screen with multiple actions.

behavior.appears: Always visible or shown contextually when actions are available.
behavior.interaction: Tap action buttons to execute commands. May hide on scroll.
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists while context requires actions.

platformVariations.name: UIToolbar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom bar with icon-only buttons and flexible spacing. Translucent with blur.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Appears at the bottom of a navigation controller. Hides on push navigation in some contexts.

platformVariations.name: NSToolbar
platformVariations.visualNotes: Top toolbar integrated with the window title bar. Supports icons, labels, and mixed.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: User-customizable item set. Supports flexible space, groups, and overflow. Integrates with touch bar.

platformVariations.name: Bottom App Bar / Toolbar (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Bottom app bar with action icons and optional FAB cradle. Top toolbar for contextual actions.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Bottom app bar scrolls away on scroll. Can host a centered or end FAB. Supports contextual action mode.

platformVariations.name: CommandBar (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Top bar with primary and secondary command buttons. Overflow menu for additional commands.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports compact, minimal, and hidden display modes. Secondary commands in overflow flyout.

platformVariations.name: Toolbar (ARIA)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Horizontal grouping of buttons and controls. Styled with CSS frameworks.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use role='toolbar' for the container. Arrow keys navigate between items. Tab moves focus out of the toolbar.

name: Menu Button / Split Button
description: A button that opens a dropdown menu of related actions, or a split button combining a default action with a dropdown for alternatives.

parts.label: Primary Action Area
parts.description: The main clickable area that either opens the menu or triggers the default action.

parts.label: Dropdown Arrow
parts.description: A chevron or arrow indicator that the button opens a menu.

parts.label: Divider (Split)
parts.description: Vertical line separating the primary action from the dropdown trigger in split buttons.

parts.label: Dropdown Menu
parts.description: The list of alternative actions that appears on click.

placement.position: Inline within toolbars, forms, and action areas
placement.context: Used when a primary action has related alternatives (Save/Save As, Reply/Reply All).

behavior.appears: Always visible where a set of related actions exists.
behavior.interaction: Click the button to trigger default action or open the menu; click arrow for menu in split variant.
behavior.dismissal: Menu closes on item selection, outside click, or Escape.

platformVariations.name: NSPopUpButton (pull-down) / NSSegmentedControl
platformVariations.visualNotes: Pull-down button with downward arrow; distinct from pop-up buttons which show current value.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Click opens menu below the button. Keyboard: Space opens, arrow keys navigate.

platformVariations.name: Split Button (Material 3)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Divided button with primary action and trailing dropdown arrow.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Primary area triggers default action. Trailing area opens a dropdown menu of alternatives.

platformVariations.name: SplitButton / DropDownButton (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Button with a divider and dropdown chevron. Supports toggle split button variant.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Primary click triggers action. Chevron click opens flyout menu. Keyboard: Alt+Down opens menu.

platformVariations.name: Menu Button (ARIA)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Button with dropdown arrow that opens a menu. Often part of button groups in toolbars.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use aria-haspopup='menu' and aria-expanded. Enter/Space opens menu. Arrow keys navigate menu items.

name: Rating Indicator
description: A control displaying a row of stars (or other symbols) that lets users view or set a rating value.

parts.label: Rating Symbols
parts.description: Row of star (or custom) icons representing the rating scale.

parts.label: Filled State
parts.description: Filled icons representing the current rating value.

parts.label: Empty State
parts.description: Outlined or dimmed icons for unrated positions.

parts.label: Half-Star
parts.description: Optional partial fill for half-point ratings.

parts.label: Label / Caption
parts.description: Optional text showing the numeric value or description.

placement.position: Inline within reviews, product pages, and feedback forms
placement.context: Used for product reviews, content ratings, feedback forms, and quality indicators.

behavior.appears: Read-only when displaying existing ratings; interactive in input mode.
behavior.interaction: Click or tap a star to set the rating; hover to preview (desktop).
behavior.dismissal: Not dismissible; persists as an input or display control.

platformVariations.name: NSLevelIndicator (rating)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Row of stars with system styling; supports 0–5 scale.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Supports editable and read-only modes. Can display partial stars for half ratings.

platformVariations.name: RatingControl (WinUI)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Row of star glyphs with Fluent Design. Supports custom max value and placeholder value.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Interactive or read-only. Supports half-star precision. Keyboard accessible with arrow keys.

platformVariations.name: Star Rating (custom)
platformVariations.visualNotes: Custom star icons using SVG or Unicode characters. Styled with CSS for filled/empty states.
platformVariations.behaviorNotes: Use role='slider' with aria-valuenow, aria-valuemin, aria-valuemax. Arrow keys adjust value. Tab to focus.
